title: Introduction to Marketing
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to introduction to marketing. Students will learn fundamental concepts including decision, operations, profit. The course covers growth, strategy with emphasis on practical performance. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in marketing and strategy.
scope: Topics covered include: financial statements, market research, strategic planning, and budgeting. Students should have basic knowledge of management. Prerequisites: None or introductory business course.

title: Educational Psychology
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to educational psychology. Students will learn fundamental concepts including learning, education, curriculum. The course covers student, teaching with emphasis on practical cognition. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in instruction and teaching.
scope: Topics covered include: educational technology, behavior management, learning styles, and differentiated instruction. Students should have basic knowledge of pedagogy. Prerequisites: None or introductory education course.

title: Materials Science
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to materials science. Students will learn fundamental concepts including process, modeling, testing. The course covers engineering, specification with emphasis on practical specification. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in engineering and testing.
scope: Topics covered include: material properties, force dynamics, mechanical systems, and stress analysis. Students should have basic knowledge of measurement. Prerequisites: None or introductory engineering course.

title: Business Analytics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to business analytics. Students will learn fundamental concepts including value, performance, planning. The course covers marketing, customer with emphasis on practical decision. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in operations and management.
scope: Topics covered include: stakeholder management, budgeting, market research, and supply chain. Students should have basic knowledge of innovation. Prerequisites: None or introductory business course.

title: Structural Analysis
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to structural analysis. Students will learn fundamental concepts including modeling, engineering, principles. The course covers design, system with emphasis on practical application. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in optimization and system.
scope: Topics covered include: material properties, electrical circuits, force dynamics, and heat transfer. Students should have basic knowledge of simulation. Prerequisites: None or introductory engineering course.
